es.ucm.fdi.tp.basecode.bgame.control

Class ConsoleCtrl

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.ucm.fdi.tp.basecode.bgame.control.Controller
      • es.ucm.fdi.tp.basecode.bgame.control.ConsoleCtrl
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConsoleCtrlMVC

    public class ConsoleCtrl
extends Controller
    A console controller that does not use MVC -- you can see this in the start() method since it prints the state of the game in each iteration of the while loop, etc.

    Clase controlador que no usa MVC -- Se puede ver en el metodo start() que imprime el estado del juego en cada iteracion del bucle while, etc.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Scanner in
      A scanner from which we ask for command (e.g., play, quit, etc.).
      protected java.util.Map<Piece,Player> players
      A map that associates pieces with players (manual, random, etc.).

      • Fields inherited from class es.ucm.fdi.tp.basecode.bgame.control.Controller

        game, pieces

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ConsoleCtrl(Game game, java.util.List<Piece> pieces, java.util.List<Player> players, java.util.Scanner in)
      Construct a controller for playing game, with a a list of pieces where the i-th piece should be played by the i-th player in the list players.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void initializeCommandsSet()
      Initializes the set of command in CommandSet.
      void makeMove(Player p)
      We override Controller.makeMove(Player) to ignore its parameter and fetch the player from the players table.
      void start()
      Starts the controller, which includes a loop that asks for one command in each iteration until either the game is over or the user ask to 'quit' the game.

    • Field Detail

      • players

        protected java.util.Map<Piece,Player> players
        A map that associates pieces with players (manual, random, etc.).

        Map que asocia fichas con jugadores (manual, random, etc.).

      • in

        protected java.util.Scanner in
        A scanner from which we ask for command (e.g., play, quit, etc.).

        Scanner desde el que se solicitan comandos (por ejemplo, play, quit, etc.).

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConsoleCtrl

        public ConsoleCtrl(Game game,
           java.util.List<Piece> pieces,
           java.util.List<Player> players,
           java.util.Scanner in)
        Construct a controller for playing game, with a a list of pieces where the i-th piece should be played by the i-th player in the list players. Thus, the lists of pieces and players should be of the same length.

        Construye un controlador para jugar al juego game con una lista de fichas pieces en la que la i-esima ficha es la que utiliza el i-esimo jugador de la lista de jugadores players. Por tanto, ambas listas deben ser de la misma longitud.

        Parameters:
        game - A game.
        pieces - A list of pieces.
        players - A list of players.
        in - A scanner from which we ask for a string representing a command (e.g., play, quit, etc.)

    • Method Detail

      • makeMove

        public void makeMove(Player p)
        We override Controller.makeMove(Player) to ignore its parameter and fetch the player from the players table.

        Se sobrescribe Controller.makeMove(Player) para ignorar su parametro y obtener el jugador de la tabla de jugadores.

        Overrides:
        makeMove in class Controller
        Parameters:
        p - Typically null since it is ignored.

        Normalmente es null pues se ignora.

      • initializeCommandsSet

        protected void initializeCommandsSet()
        Initializes the set of command in CommandSet. It is called in the constructor ConsoleCtrl(Game, List, List, Scanner). You can override it to change the set of supported commands.

        Inicializa la lista de comandos en CommandSet. Este metodo es llamado desde el constructor ConsoleCtrl(Game, List, List, Scanner). Se puede sobrescribir para cambiar el conjunto de comandos permitidos.

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the controller, which includes a loop that asks for one command in each iteration until either the game is over or the user ask to 'quit' the game.

        Arranca el controlador, que incluye un bucle que pide una accion en cada iteracion hasta que el juego termina o el usuario solicita terminar juego con el comando 'quit'.

        Overrides:
        start in class Controller
